sentences.sContent: The journey would impose extra expense on those least able to afford it.
sentences.sCn: 这次旅行会给那些最负担不起的人增加额外的开支。

sentences.sContent: It is quite amazing what turns up when you are least expecting it.
sentences.sCn: 真的很奇妙，你根本想不到会有什么出现。

sentences.sContent: He’s my least favourite member of staff.
sentences.sCn: 他是最不讨我喜欢的员工。

sentences.sContent: I try to offend the least amount of people possible.

synos.tran: 最小的；最少的（little的最高级）

phrases.pCn: 最小二乘法；最小平方法
最小二乘法，最小二乗法
无论如何（等于at the very least）
最小二乘法；最小平方法

trans.tranOther: less than anything or anyone else
You use the least to mean a smaller amount than anyone or anything else, or the smallest amount possible
even if something better is not true or is not done
